c74object.name: jeyhisto~
c74object.digest: Derives histograms (probability-distribution plots) from incoming samples by means of Binning and Razoring
c74object.description: It only performs the analysis within the fixed range "0 ≤ samples ≤ 1" so avoids analysing the values that exceed the allowed range 0-1.

inlet.digest: (0 ≤ SIGNAL ≤ 1) numbers to be analysed (2 ≤ INT. ≤ 32767) resolution of histograms (BANG) outputting a histogram (MESSAGEs) various arguments

outlet.digest: (BANG) done bang after outputting a histogram

objarg.name: resolution
objarg.description: [default: 128] The maximum resolution (size) of the histograms is 32767, and the minimum is 2. Negative values turn to positives, and the values that exceed the range 2-32767 will be ignored.

objarg.name: analysis-method
objarg.description: [default: 1] Negative values turn to positives, and the values greater than 1 will be wrapped.

objarg.name: auto-reset
objarg.digest: resetting analysis data after ouputting it
objarg.description: [default: 1] Any value greater than 0 turns on the flag.

attribute.name: err_msg
attribute.description: [default: 0] Any value greater than 0 turns on the attribute.

attribute.name: normalize
attribute.description: [default: 1] Any value greater than 0 turns on the attribute.

attribute.name: autoreset
attribute.digest: resetting analysis data after ouputting it
attribute.description: [default: 1] Any value greater than 0 turns on the attribute.

method.name: bang
method.description: The object can output a histogram when the number of analysed sample(s) is greater than 0.

method.name: mode
method.description: [default: 1] Negative values turn to positives, and the values greater than 1 will be wrapped.

method.name: autoreset
method.digest: resetting analysis data after ouputting it
method.description: [default: 1] Any value greater than 0 turns on the attribute.

method.name: col
method.digest: activate or inactivate analysing incoming samples
method.description: [default: 1] Any value greater than 0 turns on the attribute.
